DM [CreamPuff] BOT 01-08-2024 23:01
A few weeks have passed since James and Celeste returned to their half-wrecked home from the fortress of some cloud giants they visited high above the valley. At times, they can't believe it's real, until they think back to certain funny moments (like Celeste conjuring up an illusory Tavoros who made the most unsavory of gestures to distract a giantess) and laugh between themselves. Or the fact that a single strawberry Celeste brought back has been turned into two short cakes, 10 jars of strawberry jam, and she's waiting for some giant seeds she has extracted to germinate in the darkness of her basement, each seed requiring its own large ceramic pot. *Or the fact that James is still wearing a magical breastplate he ripped off of the dead body of a mummy lord they slew together, or the fine black obsidian dust covering Celeste's garden patch... In the weeks since, the couple threw all of their energy into repairing their home. It's not an easy feat to patch up a roof, a floor, and several walls that were destroyed by a magical beanstalk. But there's a certain joy in falling into a comfortable rhythm of hard work. She has created a new garden patch, and James has got the house repairs done. And another wonderful little addition came into their relatively quiet lives. Marta, an 8 year old girl from Barovia village, whom James recruited personally to become Celeste's apprentice, has been coming to the house every other day to help her brew potions and grind up herbs. She is sweet, with sandy hair and big brown eyes, and a quick learner, appreciating hanging out with the young couple almost as much as she's been enjoying the stipend James pays her. Marta has brought Celeste a hand-sewn stuffed raven, and even asked James to show her some dagger fundamentals.*

Narrator (Rat) BOT 02-08-2024 18:59
_After a few weeks, the house finally resembles something resembling "finished." James and Celeste are hardly construction professionals, but that's... not really the point. They had done this by themselves. Rebuilt, made improvements on their own home, together. No matter how good or bad it may be, they did that._ _And what better way to celebrate than a party? The last time they saw many of their friends was a funeral, and the circumstances there were waaay different. And even though it's officially behind them at this point, the magic beanstalk thing was just one more thing to go on top of the pile of shit Barovia throws at you every chance it can. So really, a nice night like that is long overdue anyway._ _So it's decided. The night before the night of the full moon. Many are invited. Friends, friends of friends, locals James and/or Celeste had made good with. Food, drinks, cards. It promises to be just a good time._ ----------- _It's the night of the party. Skies are clear, and the moon hangs clearly in the sky. It isn't_ technically _full, but James can still feel that agitation within him. It otherwise promises to be a good night. Not too hot, nice breeze, preparations have been going smoothly. But for James there's just... something. Maybe it's something in the air, maybe it's the moon, but there's just this feeling that not everything is quite right, despite all evidence to the contrary._
